en:
"I am from Utah, visiting Dresden. The city is very welcoming and hospitable, like Utah. I am Mormon. I am not here for a mission, but I do go to the Mormon church from time to time and visit with the brothers and sisters.

I have seen people protesting sometimes in Dresden. I just look at them and see frustration. They don't want to see other people in Europe, but if you go to other continents, you will find Europeans. Europeans are in the US, Africa, all over the world. Why don't they want to see foreigners in Europe, when they are invading other continents? I can't imagine that people in Dresden think like that. Maybe the protestors are from other places."
